required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Extension Study to Assess Long Term Safety in Children and Adolescents With Crohn's Disease Receiving Certolizumab Pegol
clinical_study.official_title: An Open-label, Multicenter Study to Assess the Safety of Certolizumab Pegol in Children and Adolescents With Active Crohn's Disease Who Completed C87035 (NCT00899678) or Who Were Terminated From C87035

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the long-term safety and tolerability of certolizumab pegol (CZP) treatment in children and adolescents with moderately to severely active Crohn's disease. Secondarily, to assess the long-term efficacy, pharmacokinetics (PK), and immunogenicity of CZP treatment in children and adolescents with moderately to severely active Crohn's disease.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects Reporting at Least One Treatment-Emergent Adverse Event (TEAE) During Study Treatment (up to 303 Weeks)
primary_outcome.description: Treatment-Emergent Adverse Events (TEAEs) are any untoward medical incidence in a subject during administered study treatment, whether or not these events are related to study treatment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects Discontinuing Treatment Due to a Treatment-Emergent Adverse Event (TEAE)
secondary_outcome.description: Treatment-Emergent Adverse Events (TEAEs) are any untoward medical incidence in a subject during administered study treatment, whether or not these events are related to study treatment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects Who Develop Anti-nuclear Antibodies During the Study
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At the time of completion or termination visit (up to 298 weeks)
secondary_outcome.description: Anti-nuclear antibodies (ANA) are autoantibodies. ANA titers will be determined every 12 weeks starting at Week 14, and at the Completion/Early Termination and Safety Follow-Up (SFU) Visits.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects Who Develop Double-stranded Deoxyribonucleic Acid (dsDNA) Antibodies During the Study
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At the time of completion or termination visit (up to 298 weeks)
secondary_outcome.description: Anti-dsDNA are autoantibodies. Anti-dsDNA titers will be determined every 12 weeks starting at Week 14, and at the Completion/Early Termination and Safety Follow-Up (SFU) Visits.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Subjects in Clinical Remission
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At the time of completion or termination visit (up to 298 weeks)
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of subjects in clinical remission (clinical remission is defined as a Pediatric Crohn's Disease Activity Index (PCDAI) score ≤ 10)

arm_group.description: 400 mg administered subcutaneously every 4 weeks for subjects ≥ 40 kg or 200 mg for subjects 20 to < 40 kg
200 mg administered subcutaneously every 4 weeks for subjects ≥ 40 kg or 100 mg for subjects 20 to < 40 kg

intervention.description: 400 mg administered subcutaneously every 4 weeks for subjects ≥ 40 kg or 200 mg for subjects 20 to < 40 kg
200 mg administered subcutaneously every 4 weeks for subjects ≥ 40 kg or 100 mg for subjects 20 to < 40 kg

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Subject who completed the C87035 study (NCT00899678) through Week 62 or assessments when their participation in C87035 was terminated when the study was stopped by UBC
- Subject completed all assessments required for Week 62/Visit 23 at the time of termination
- Subjects maintain stable regimen of concomitant medications for Crohn's Disease (CD) throughout study
Exclusion Criteria:
- Subject who did not complete the C87035 study (Week 62 Visit), was terminated or did not complete all of the Week 62 assessments when their participation from C87035 was terminated when the study was stopped by UCB but did not complete all assessments required for Week 62/Visit 23 at the time of termination

clinical_study.keyword: Children and Adolescents with Crohn's Disease

participant_flow.recruitment_details: The study started to enroll patients in August 2010 and concluded in November 2017.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: The study included an Open Label treatment period, having 16 subjects enrolled in the Safety Set (SS) shown in the Participant Flow.

group.title: Certolizumab Pegol: Low-dose Group (Weight Adjusted)
group.description: 200 mg administered subcutaneously every 4 weeks for subjects >= 40 kg or 100 mg for subjects 20 to < 40 kg. Part of the Safety Set (SS) included all subjects enrolled, who received at least 1 injection of study treatment in this study.

group.title: Certolizumab Pegol: High-dose Group (Weight Adjusted)
group.description: 400 mg administered subcutaneously every 4 weeks for subjects >= 40 kg or 200 mg for subjects 20 to < 40 kg. Part of the Safety Set (SS) included all subjects enrolled, who received at least 1 injection of study treatment in this study.

baseline.population: Baseline Characteristics refer to the Safety Set which included all subjects enrolled in the study.

group.title: Certolizumab Pegol: Low-dose Group (Weight Adjusted)
group.description: 200 mg administered subcutaneously every 4 weeks for subjects >= 40 kg or 100 mg for subjects 20 to < 40 kg. Part of the Safety Set (SS) included all subjects enrolled, who received at least 1 injection of study treatment in this study.

group.title: Certolizumab Pegol: High-dose Group (Weight Adjusted)
group.description: 400 mg administered subcutaneously every 4 weeks for subjects >= 40 kg or 200 mg for subjects 20 to < 40 kg. Part of the Safety Set (SS) included all subjects enrolled, who received at least 1 injection of study treatment in this study.

outcome.title: Number of Subjects Reporting at Least One Treatment-Emergent Adverse Event (TEAE) During Study Treatment (up to 303 Weeks)
outcome.description: Treatment-Emergent Adverse Events (TEAEs) are any untoward medical incidence in a subject during administered study treatment, whether or not these events are related to study treatment.
outcome.population: The Safety Set (SS) included all subjects enrolled, who received at least 1 injection of study treatment in this study.

group.title: Certolizumab Pegol: Low-dose Group (Weight Adjusted) – (SS)
group.description: 200 mg administered subcutaneously every 4 weeks for subjects >= 40 kg or 100 mg for subjects 20 to < 40 kg. Part of the Safety Set (SS) included all subjects enrolled, who received at least 1 injection of study treatment in this study.

group.title: Certolizumab Pegol: High-dose Group (Weight Adjusted) – (SS)
group.description: 400 mg administered subcutaneously every 4 weeks for subjects >= 40 kg or 200 mg for subjects 20 to < 40 kg. Part of the Safety Set (SS) included all subjects enrolled, who received at least 1 injection of study treatment in this study.

group.title: Certolizumab Pegol: Re-Induction Group – (SS)
group.description: If a subject had not been previously reinduced in C87035, the subject is eligible for 1 reinduction due to loss of response in CR0012. Reinduction Week 0 (first reinduction dose) is followed by Reinduction Week 2 (second dose, 2 weeks after first dose), and Reinduction Week 4 (third dose, 2 weeks after second dose). The reinduction dose was adjusted to the subject’s weight: 400 mg for subjects ≥ 40 kg or 200 mg for subjects 20 to < 40 kg subcutaneously Q2W for a total of 3 doses. After reinduction was complete participants continued dosing with CZP administered subcutaneously Q4W as 400 mg for subjects ≥ 40 kg or 200mg for subjects 20 to < 40 kg, regardless of the subject’s previous randomized dose group). Part of the Safety Set (SS) included all subjects enrolled, who received at least 1 injection of study treatment in this study.

outcome.title: Number of Subjects Who Develop Anti-nuclear Antibodies During the Study
outcome.description: Anti-nuclear antibodies (ANA) are autoantibodies. ANA titers will be determined every 12 weeks starting at Week 14, and at the Completion/Early Termination and Safety Follow-Up (SFU) Visits.
outcome.time_frame: At the time of completion or termination visit (up to 298 weeks)
outcome.population: The Intention-to-Treat (ITT) Population included all subjects irrespective of any protocol deviations who received at least 1 injection of the study treatment and who had at least 1 efficacy measurement after the first injection of this study.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is more than 60 days but less than or equal to 180 days. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.
